data.title: Cute little museum
data.text: The museum looked brand new and is small but pristine. There was a  larger variation of artists than I expected. I absolutely loved it and bought a year pass.

data.title: Visited it and pleasantly surprised
data.text: Popped by and visited it on a whim, so glad I did so.  Interesting building, great art works, fab gift shop.  will be back soon.

data.title: a very nice experience
data.text: Toured the museum for the first time and had a wonderful experience.  The facility is attractive and well maintained, exhibits are well displayed and presented and the snack area is very nice.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: Great little museum that gives the big dogs a run for their money.  Thoughtful and informed exhibits, terrific permanent collection, and very accessbile. Must see!

data.title: A delight......
data.text:
This is a great place to visit. Really interesting collections, old and modern. Exhibits are well displayed in a spacious building. Great cafe, super helpful staff. The Zimmerman house is just wonderful. The gift shop has a really good range of high quality gifts. 
I was lucky enough to be there on one of the Museum's evening openings, where there was music, a bar, and a great atmosphere. Fantastic to see Picasso, Hopper, Matisse etc in such intimate surroundings. Would have happily gone back for a 2nd day if time permitted!

data.title: A Gem of a Museum
data.text:
I agree with slabbs.  I thoroughly enjoyed the Mount Washington exhibit -- what an introduction to the wonders and history of the White Mountains.  But the permanent exhibitions of modern art, European Art from the Renaissance and beyond, and American art (with a special emphasis on colonial New England furniture) are also amazing.  The curators packed a lot of great art into a small museum, and it is well worth the admission price.

I wished I had time to visit the Zimmerman House, but I must save that for the next trip.

data.title: Saw the Mount Washington exhibit
data.text: Wonderful museum with examples of many famous artists.  We very much enjoyed the special exhibit of paintings of the Mt Washington and surrounding countryside beautifully painted and explained.

data.title: Interesting place to visit
data.text: Really enjoyed my visit here.  Very diverse exhibition, with lots to see.  Guess not much else to do in Manchester!!

data.title: Enjoyable Museun
data.text:
Great small and enjoyable museum with art from mostly American and Western paintings from medieval to modern eras. Surprisingly for the size they had some masterpieces by Picasso, Matisse and Monet. When we visited the special exhibit was a collection of paintings and vintage photos of Mt. Washington and the White Mountains wilderness from the 18th and 19th century. 

They do offer docent led tour of the exhibits. The docent  was great and was happy to focus on our interests. 

Handicap accessible.

data.title: Nice art gallery
data.text: Great place to spend a day. Nice mix of permanent and temporary exhibits. Nice layout and helpful staff.

data.title: Great Day
data.text: This is a wonderful way to spend a couple of hours with the family.  The white mtn exibit was very nice.  Beautiful scenes from just 2 hours away.

data.title: Beautiful  building, good collections, Frank Lloyd Wright house tour.
data.text: Great mid-size museum - the building is lovely, terrific permanent collection & interesting exhibits. The Frank Lloyd Wright house tour is a real gem - not to be missed (book ahead).  Very good cafe on premise, good stop for lunch before or after touring the museum.  Docents & staff are excellent.

data.title: Picasso to Frank Lloyd Wright
data.text:
This is a superb small museum with some significant works including a large Picasso. 
The Frank Lloyd Wright Zimmerman house forms part of the collection and is a must see. 
A great light cafe, friendly staff, beautiful building makes for a great day in Manchester

data.title: GREAT place to take a date!
data.text: My wife was an art major at UNH.  We went there for a saturday lunch & stroll thru the galleries.  I was VERY impressed with the depth of the collection & how it was laid out. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Great LITTLE Museum
data.text: Great little museum. Number one reason we went was to see the Zimmerman house, but the museum was a nice surprise! In the collection oils by Maxfield Parrish, Louis Comfort Tiffany, Childe Hassam, along with regional art, contemporary (not My favorite)... a work or two by many artists. A nice surprise when I had no expectations. We did not, unfortunately, have time to visit the Mount Washington exhibit!

data.title: Still The Same
data.text:
If you go at all, go for the solid art collections and exhibits. The first few times I went to this museum, I was with my daughters. Each time, we were stalked by the docents, making it difficult to enjoy the art. This last time, I went with a friend (adult). Friendly front desk staff greeted us and so I thought, "this time will be different!" Sadly, no, it was not. We were still followed around and in one of the galleries, the docent there literally paced at a fast clip across the room, over and over. At times, he even brushed past me and my friend. I don't understand why the Currier has such overzealous/aggressive docents - I have never felt as uncomfortable in a museum as I have each time I visited the Currier. I like that we have good quality art to appreciate, but please, Currier powers that be, please be kinder and less aggressive so your patrons can enjoy their experience there.

That said, the cafe is nice and I had the best sandwich there - it was an Asian-inspired sandwich with pork belly - it was surprisingly delicious and I would go there just for that if I knew for sure it was still on the menu, but I hesitate to return because of all of the uncomfortable experiences that have left a bad taste in my mouth. I don't see similar complaints in other reviews - am I the only one noticing this and it's not as bad as I think it is? Or, are people just not aware of what is going on around them? No idea. I want to give the Currier the benefit of the doubt but it's hard to when each time I go, I experience the same thing.

owner_response.author: curriermuseum, Director of Public Relations and Marketing at Currier Museum of Art, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Hungrymom2015,

I'm so sorry to hear that you felt uncomfortable in your recent visits to the Currier. We appreciate candid, helpful reviews, and yours, while not giving us high marks, will prove helpful. 

I think you are probably referring to our Security team, rather than the docents. The docents are volunteers who provide tours of the Museum and Zimmerman House. I will pass this information on to our head of Security and see what adjustments they can make in this regard. Do know that sometimes, when the Museum isn't filled with visitors, it can seem like you're being "trailed" by Security, but they are simply being moved from room to room to provide a safe experience for you (and the art, of course). It would be helpful to know the circumstances surrounding your visit so we can work on improvements. If you don't mind, feel free to write me (Steve) at: infocus@currier.org. 

I'll pass along your compliments to our chef. I do hope you stop by again sometime and give the Museum another look. Thank you again for your comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Such a treasure
data.text: This small museum is such an asset to the community. We come up from Boston for many of the special exhibits... and the fall 2016 show on Mt Washington was well worth the trip. The museum staff are always welcoming and friendly too. Close to the highway, convenient and easy parking, and a decent cafe. What's not to like?

data.title: Visit to Museum and Zimmerman House
data.text:
A great free museum with the opportunity to visit Frank Lloyd Wright's Zimmerman House for an additional fee.
Had a fantastic visit to the house, and if you like architecture or like me a fan of Frank Lloyd Wright, a visit to this house is a must.

data.title: Good Local Museum
data.text: Enjoyed the visit on a rainy day and was Surprised by the extent of the permanent collection. Good selection of regional glass, furniture and paintings. Lovely mosaics at the old entrance.

data.title: The Art of the High Heeled Shoe
data.text: First time to this museum and it was wonderful! Beautiful building with a huge mosaic. Not what I expected for a museum in Manchester. I was pleasantly surprised! The exhibit we sent to see was fabulous. 300 hundred years of fashion from around the world. I think about 150 shoes. Very nice cafe with good food and reasonable prices in a lovely setting. Recommend highly!
